data.name: Housing Crisis
data.text: The housing crisis refers to a period of time when there is a shortage of affordable housing. This can lead to an increase in homelessness and a decrease in quality of life for those affected. As an investor, it's important to be aware of the housing crisis and consider how your investments may impact the housing market.

data.name: Ethics of Property Investing
data.text: As a property investor, it's important to consider the ethical implications of your investments. This includes avoiding properties with a history of discrimination or unethical practices, and ensuring that your investments contribute to the community in a positive way. Additionally, consider the impact of gentrification on the local community and seek to mitigate negative effects.

questions.text: What should property investors consider when it comes to ethics?

answers.text: Avoiding properties with a history of discrimination or unethical practices
Investing only in properties with the highest potential returns

questions.text: How can property investors contribute to the community in a positive way?

answers.text: Ensuring that investments benefit the community
Ignoring the needs of the community

questions.text: What is gentrification and why should property investors seek to mitigate its negative effects?

answers.text: Gentrification is the process of renovating and improving a neighborhood, often leading to displacement of lower-income residents. Investors should seek to mitigate negative effects to prevent harm to the community.
Gentrification is the process of investing in high-end properties only. Investors should embrace this process to maximize profits.
Gentrification is the process of creating affordable housing in low-income neighborhoods. Investors should support this process to help the community.
